alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 25 at 5:13AM PST until December 27 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Oregon Cascades, including Crater Lake, and Siskiyou Mountains, including Mt. Ashland. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages will be possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels lower around 7 AM to where heavy, wet snow falling at one inch per hour is very likely to cause white out conditions, which would severely restrict visibility. The combination for heavy snow and strong winds will also increase the chance for trees to fall. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
